BCG vaccination confers decreased risk of severe childhood TB disease in high‐burden areas, an effect negated by low vaccine coverage.
6 Besides protection against TB, BCG vaccination also modulates the immune response to subsequent infections caused by other pathogens, including viruses, by the induction of innate immunity and heterologous lymphocyte activation.
7 ,
8 In this case, the question raised is whether lack of BCG vaccination increased susceptibility to severe pulmonary TB, COVID‐19, and possibly other viral coinfection. The protective effects of BCG vaccination against severity and poor outcome in COVID‐19 infection is currently a subject of clinical trials.
